description:
flip of http://www.comicvine.com/gargantarama-the-comic-book-3/4000-238079/

When Ms. Victory responds to strange happenings at a local junkyard, she finds herself battered by a hidden foe, make that 3 foes as the villains Valkyra, Alexandria the Greatest, and Prom Queen, take their turns with the Femforce powerhouse! Story by Paul Monsky, art by Ed Coutts. Then Nightveil tracks a serial killer in a short story by Enrico Teodorani with art by Ken Hunt, followed by another Ms. Victory solo tale as the heroine is "One Against Evil," in a tale again written by Enrico Teodorani but with art this time by Antonio Conversano. The flip-side of this issue is the third installment of Gargantarama, the Comic Book!
name: Trashed! (Gargantarama #3 flip book)

description: Irish of the Jungle, AC Comics' tribute to legendary actress and pin-up queen, Irish McCalla, takes on some remnants of the Axis to rescue Rio Rita in a tale written by Paul Monsky with art by Gene Gonzales. Also, Chris Irving pens a story of She-Cat and Miss Masque having a face-off against Bastis aboard a cruise ship with art by Larry Guidry, Mark Heike, and Jeff Austin, followed by "One Flesh, One Will" in which Ms. Victory and Paragon face the menace of Atavis the Animist and Golthus with art by Chad Halcom and Mark Heike based upon a script by Chad Halcom. Then, writer Paul Monsky delivers the first part of an illustrated text story, "The Victor and the Vanquished," with art by Ed Coutts, in which Tara is put to the test against N'Dula, warrior queen! Finally, Enrico Teodorani and Marco Caldi spin short tale of the Blue Bulleteer!
name: Welcome to the Jungle

description:
This "80 Page Giant G-49" is a collection reprints about Batman's super-sanctum, The Batcave! Plus a 2 page view of the Batcave, and a Batmobile story are also included.

  1. The 1000 Secrets of the Batcave! (Batman, Robin, Commissioner Gordon / written by Bill Finger : reprinted from: Batman #48)

An escaped convict accidentally finds the Batcave. Will he tell the world his discovery?

  1. Cap's Hobby Hints (by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. The Birth of Batplane II! (Batman, Robin / written by David Vern Reed : reprinted from: Batman #61)

  3. Secrets of the Batcave - 1968

Gives a big, 2 page view of the Batcave. The next 2 pages are various Bat-gadgets.

  1. The Secret of Batmans Utility Belt! (Batman, Robin / written by David Reed?)

  2. The 100 Batarangs of Batman (Batman, Robin, Commissioner Gordon / written by Bill Finger : reprinted from: Detective Comics #244)

Who stole the film that shows Batman using various Batarangs?

  1. The Secret of the Batmobile (Batman, Robin, Vicki Vale / written by Bill Finger : reprinted from: Batman #98)

Vicki takes a picture of the Batmobile in action. What secrets could that picture reveal?

  1. The Flying Bat-Cave! (Batman, Robin : reprinted from: Detective Comics #186)

A flying prototype of the Batcave is made.
name: The Secrets of the Batcave!

description:
One-Shot Handbook answering all your questions concerning the Marvel Ultimate Universe from Bishop-Vulture. Apart from Ultimate character profiles, this issue also has an Ultimate Updates section chronicling any new changes since the last Ultimate Handbook. As it is with most Handbooks these days you also have two profiles on a couple of the people behind the book, Stuart Vandal and David Wiltfong. You can also find a list of every Ultimate Universe Handbook to date on the inside cover.

Head Writer/Coordinators:

Stuart Vandal & Sean McQuad

Writers:

David Wiltfong, Madison Carter, Mark O'English, Mike Fichera & Ronald Byrd

Cover Art:

Greg Land, Jay Leisten & Stephanie Peru

Art Reconstruction:

Pond Scum

Select Coloring:

Tom Smith

Editors:

Jeff Youngquist & Cory Levine

Editors, Special Projects:

Jennifer Grunwald & Mark D. Beazley

Assistant Editor:

John Denning

Copy Editor:

Brian Overton

Senior Vice President of Sales:

David Gabriel

Production:

Jerron Quality Color

Vice President of Creative:

Tom Marvelli

Editor in Chief:

Joe Quesada

Publisher:

Dan Buckley
name: Ultimate Secrets

concept_credits.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

first_appearance_concepts.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

description:
Part 1 of 2 Zoom and Cheetah want to make Flash and Wonder Woman better heroes.

Boston- Minerva, the current Cheetah, convinces Dr. Zolomon, the current Zoom to help her learn how to increase her speed.

Keystone City- Wally learns that Zoom has escaped from Ironside, and rushes over to the prison. There he learns that Minerva helped Zoom escape, and killed three guards in the process.

New York- Diana, the current and blinded Wonder Woman, battles Giganta. It appears that Wonder Woman may have met her match but then Wally shows up and distracts Giganta long enough for Diana to knock her out.

The Themysciran Embassy- Wally asks Diana to help him track down Cheetah. Diana agrees but Wally has to take the blinded Wonder Woman with him.

Central City- Captain Cold tries to figure out who Owen Mercer's mother is. His investigation is put on hold when Weather Wizard arrives with a note. The note is a challenge from the Top, his rouges versus Cold's rouges.

Boston- Zoom tries to teach Cheetah how to unlock her true potential, and comes to the conclusion to be her best she must be the only Cheetah.

Later Flash and Wonder Woman track Zoom and Cheetah to the home of Priscilla Rich. Wally find Priscilla's lifeless body. Before the heroes can do anything they are ambushed by Zoom and a super speed Cheetah.

Continued in Wonder Woman #214
name: Truth or Dare Part 1
Crusade

description:
Overview

Ripped from the pages of Infinite Crisis! The Society has orchestrated one of the biggest acts of terror the world has ever seen - a global prison break. But when all of Earth's mightiest heroes are missing in action, who will be there to stop the tide of evil that threatens to engulf the entire planet?
name: A Hero Dies But Once

description:
Bart, Milhouse, and Ralph venture into unknown territory ? a crosstown Kwik-E-Mart ? to seek out "The Squishee of Death"; Lisa uncovers a insidious crime against her Malibu Stacy collection and all signs point to one culprit... Bart Simpson; Milhouse gets a new look for School Picture Day; and Bart breaks a few rules in order to taint Ned Flanders' spotless reputation. Misbehave with Bart this February!

1. Picture Day (written by Michael Nobori)

It's school picture day and Milhouse gets gum in his hair! How can Bart help in this situation?

2. The Squish of Death (written by James Bates)

Bart, Milhouse, and Ralph try "The Squishee of Death"! Super brain freeze, anyone?

3. The Case of the Headless Dolls (The Secret Files of Lisa Simpson : written by Earl Kress and Terry Delegeane)

Someone has taken the heads of Lisa's Malibu Stacy dolls, and Bart is the prime suspect.

4. Zone Wars (written by Bryan Uhlenbrock)

Can Bart ruin Ned Flander's perfect reputation?

5. Bart's People (letters and fan art)
name: Mischief Menace

description:
1. Appointments (Cerebus)

Theresa tells Weisshaupt about Astoria, who founded Kevillism. Theres some grumblings by Julius and Leonardi about how Weisshaupt is running things. Cerebus has been appointed as the new Eastern Pontiff by Powers.

  1. Unique Story! Flaming Carrot & The New People! (part 2) (Flaming Carrot)

  2. Petunia Con 84 (photographs of some of the participants of the convention)

Also includes a "Note from the Publisher," "Aardvark Comment" and an E-Man comic ad.
name: Appointments

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
1. Fee, Fi, Fo, Fudd (Goofy Gophers Mac and Tosh, Elmer Fudd)
 
2. X-Treme Sports Nuts (Foghorn, Leghorn, Henery Hawk, Barnyard Dawg, Eggbert Junior) 
 
3. Duty Duck Calls (Daffy Duck)
name: Fee, Fi, Fo, Fudd

description:
The Case of the Psycopathic Lady

In every profession there is usually one person whose highly developed skill places him far above his fellow members. When it comes to private investigators, one such man immediately comes to mind. A man of enormous talents, his wealth is surpassed only by his courage. He carries no gun, although his cases bring him in direct contact with armed and desperate criminals. A man of great generosity, he donates all his fees to worthy, recognized charities. For sheer toughness, brilliance of mind, and genuine compassion for those in distress, there is none to compare with the incomparable Mr. Risk!

The Case of the Jinxed Airline

When a fishing trip turns into a man-hunt and the lives of innocent people are at stake, it becomes a terrifying problem whose solution hinges upon one man. He is Mr. Risk, private investigator extraordinary, famed for his unselfish gestures in turning all fees over to charity, the indomitable crusader, who carries no gun, comes up against his toughest case when death strikes at the airport!

The Forgetful Chorus Girl

I've walked into enough blind alleys in my time. And into enough pitch-black cellars to fight it out with fear-crazed killers. But spare me, brother, the ticklish job of exploring the dark, mysterious passages of the human mind! When the Chief introduced me to Linda Shane and explained what had driven this venus-in-pancake-makeup to the police, I was started on the first lap of the perilous adventure of unraveling The Mystery of the Forgetful Chorus Girl!

The Trap (Text Only Story)

Seeds of Destruction

Johnny Turo! The name which sent a shudder down the spine of every man whose path he crossed! Turo the Tyrant! Turo whose heart was harder than a frozen turnip! Yes - "Poke" Bancroft knew full well the stakes were life and death when he undertook to crush the sinister racketeer known as Turo, The Vegetable King!
Mike Fleisher (Script), Al Milgrom (Pencils), Jack Abel (Inks), Alan Kupperberg (Letters).
name: Morlock Must Be Destroyed

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #3, Amazing Spider-Man #4 and Tales To Astonish #37.
Reprinting Fantastic Four #4, Tales of Suspense #40 and Incredible Hulk #3.
Reprinting Fantastic Four #7, Tales of Suspense # 41, Strange Tales #111
Reprinting Fantastic Four #8, Tales of Suspense # 42, Strange Tales #114 and Hulk #4
Reprinting Fantastic Four #9, Tales of Suspense # 43, Strange Tales and Hulk #5
Reprinting Fantastic Four #13, Tales of Suspense # 44, Strange Tales and Hulk

Chaos! embarks into a new era of high-speed action intermixed with supernatural intrigue and suspense with Jade, illustrated by hot 10th Muse artist Ken Lashley. The sensual Jade is the leader of a supernatural crime cartel pushing for dominance in her native China. She's opposed from all directions from underground crime lords to a high tech covert operations law agency led by the deadly Ko. Will the law catch up to Jade or will her dealings with a mysterious stranger turn the tides? It's a deceiving game of cat and mouse. Supernatural vs. high-tech. Taking place in the bright neon lights of Shanghai, prepare for state-of-the-art sci-fi, high technology and insane cybergentics. Jade is a quick, dark, high-octane thriller that never lets up!
name: Turn Loose The Dragon

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #14, Tales of Suspense # 46, Strange Tales & Hulk
Reprinting Fantastic Four #15, Tales of Suspense # 47, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #17, Tales of Suspense, Strange Tales

You wanted her, you got her! Chaos! Comics' most sultry femme fatale in her own mini- series! Having escaped from Hell, with a new Earthly identity, Lady Demon discovers herself at the center of an insidious web of espionage and covert operations while wrestling with the greatest curse of all: her own humanity!
name: Possession With Intent

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #20, Tales of Suspense, others

Following her breakthrough debut series Turn Loose the Dragon, Jade returns in an all-new four-issue mini-series... Jade: Redemption! Haunted by the dark deeds of her past, Jade searches for her identity in San Francisco, home to the mysterious and evil Progeny. Can Jade reconcile her past with the future she hopes to build? Who is the mysterious Iron Racer and the Progeny, and what diabolical schemes do they have planned for Jade? Find out in Jade: Redemption! Prepare yourself for high- octane martial arts action and cutting-edge anime that will blow your mind!
Reprinting Fantastic Four #18, Tales of Suspense, Strange Tales
Reprinting Fantastic Four #21, Tales of Suspense, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #22, Tales of Suspense, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #23, Tales of Suspense #57, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #24, Tales of Suspense #58, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #30, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #27, others
Reprinting Fantastic Four #28, Tales of Suspense #58, others

Reprints Fantastic Four #32 - An Alien impersonating Sue and Johnny's father breaks out of prison and becomes the dreaded Invincible Man.

Reprints Tales of Suspense #66 "If I Fail, A World Is Lost!" - Attuma plans an attack on the surface using a weapon that will fire a Nautilium shell and cause the oxygen to turn to water. Iron Man goes underwater to stop Attuma and his forces.

Reprints Tales of Suspense #58 "The Watcher Must Die!" - A conquering galactic warlord attempts to defeat the Watcher.

Reprints Strange Tales #133 "A Nameless Land, A Timeless Time!" - Strange plummets thru dimensions, finally coming to a stop in a world ruled by a female tyrant. Allowing himself to be imprisoned Strange then helps to overcome the evil ruler.
name: Death of a Hero!

description:
Reprints Fantastic Four #33 - Lady Dorma asks the Fantastic Four to assist Prince Namor in his battle against the hordes of the Barbaric Attuma .

Reprints Tales of Suspense #67 "Where Walk the Villains" - The Deadly Dream-maker (aka Count Nefaria) creates dream illusions in which Iron Man must battle his former foes of; Jack Frost, Crimson Dynamo, Melter, Black Knight, Gargantus and the Unicorn.

Reprints Tales of Suspense #59 "Captain America" - While Cap lounges around Avengers Mansion a gang of costumed thugs break in underestimating Caps abilities.

Reprints Strange Tales #136 "What Lurks Beneath the Mask?" - Strange continues his search for "Eternity" until The Aged Ghenghis tells him only he and The Ancient One know the secret. He leads Strange to a being imprisoned in another dimension, but it turns out to be a trap.
name: Side By Side with Sub-Mariner

description:
Reprints Fantastic Four #34 - A man named Gideon, the "World's Richest Man" with the power of unlimited wealth, has devised a plan that will tear the Fantastic Four apart.

Reprints Tales of Suspense #68 "If A Man Be Mad" - Tony Stark must face not only the traitorous Morgan Stark, his own cousin, but also Count Nefaria and invading aliens.

Reprints Tales of Suspense #60 "The Army of Assassins Strikes!" - Baron Zemo sends the Army of Assassins after Cap who defeats them with the help of Rick Jones.

Reprints Strange Tales #137 "When Meet the Mystic Minds!" - Dr. Strange meets deadly traps while in unconscious mind of The Ancient One to learn the secret of "Eternity".
name: A House Divided

description:
The Gentleman's Name is Gorgon!

A reprinted story from the pages of Fantastic Four #44.

Meet The Beatles!

A reprinted story from the pages of Strange Tales #130.

Among Us Hide... The Inhumans

A reprinted story from the pages of Fantastic Four #45.
name: The Gentleman's Name is Gorgon!; Meet The Beatles!; Among Us Hide... The Inhumans

description:
The Frightful Four!

Reprints Fantastic Four #36 - After a glorious (and guest-star filled) Engagement party following the announcement of Reed Richards' and Sue Storm's marriage, the Fantastic Four are attacked by a new super-villain team, the FRIGHTFUL FOUR! The cover art for MCG #28 is new and different from the cover of Fantastic Four #36. Mr. Fantastic's words on the cover are also very misleading, as the Frightful Four do not take down the Torch in this story.

The Gladiator, The Girl, and The Glory!

Reprints Tales of Suspense #76 - Cap and Batroc battle over the vial of Inferno 42.

Fight On, For A World Is Watching

Reprints Tales of Suspense #70 - Iron Man and Titanium Man continue their fight, while Happy is injured retrieving a transistor for Iron Man.

Beware, Dormammu is Watching

Reprints Strange Tales #139 - Strange and Mordo battle but Dormammu grows frustrated when Mordo is out-fought, and prepares to strike!

While this comic is from the Bronze Age, the reprinted stories herein are from the Silver Age.
name: The Frightful Four!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #47

Reed and Sue help Triton back on his feet while Ben and Johnny go after the Dragon Man. Meanwhile back at the Great Refuge, Black Bolt has returned to reclaim the crown taken from him by his brother, the troubled Maximus, who has been running the Great Refuge like a latter day Prince John during King Richard's absence.

The Fantastic Four have found a way to track down where the Inhumans have disappeared to, and soon show up in the Hidden Land, much to the delight of Crystal. Before another fight can start between the two groups, Black Bolt lets them know that if they depart immediately, there will be no ill will. Before they leave, Reed wants Black Bolt to know that they cannot stay hidden forever, and are welcome to live among the humans.

Meanwhile, in the dark dungeons of the palace, Maximus has secret plans of his own!
name: Beware the Hidden Land!

description:
A Blind Man Shall Lead Them

Reprints Fantastic Four #39 - With their Powers seemingly vanished, Reed uses his genius to devise power-mimicking gadgets for the team to wear/use, so no one will suspect they no longer have their powers. Just at that moment, Doctor Doom returns to wage war on the FF, and as they are not yet comfortable with their faux powers, are being driven back. Fortunately for the team, Daredevil is on hand, and quickly joins them in their battle!

Battle of the Baxter Building

Reprints Fantastic Four #40 - Doctor Doom has seized control of the Baxter Building, the Fantastic Four headquarters! Daredevil teams up with the FF to stop Doom, no easy task, as he has all of Reed's weapons at his disposal!

Quicksilver and the Scarlet Witch

Reprints Strange Tales #128 -
name: A Blind Man Shall Lead Them

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #48

"The Coming Of Galactus"

The conversation between Reed Richards and Black Bolt of the Inhumans have come to a staggering halt as the palace suddenly erupts with the deadly vibrations of the dread ATMO-GUN, a device capable of wiping out non-inhumans from the face of the earth!

The Gun has been covertly set off by Balck Bolt’s evil brother MAXIMUS, who believes that once the citizens of the Great Refuge realize he has wrested the world from the hands of men and have given it to the Inhumans, they will give him back the crown.

What the twisted ruler doesn’t realize is that despite what they may have believed, Humankind and Inhumankind are in fact related, and the proof lies in the very fact that all mankind is still standing after the Atmo-Gun assault, completely unaffected by the threat! Medusa speaks for Black Bolt stating that this is proof that man and inhuman must work towards the day when they can live side by side!

With nothing to lose, Maximus reverses the charge on the Atmo-gun, creating an impenetrable negative zone between the Hidden Land and the rest of the outside world! The Torch beats his fists against the dome, with no effect whatsoever. A crushed Johnny asks Reed if it will be possible to ever cross over to the Great Refuge again, but declines a reply, knowing full well the devastating answer.

Meanwhile, out in Space, an inergalactic warrior speeds towards earth with deadly intent. He is the SILVER SURFER, and he is coming to earth to claim the planet Earth for his master GALACTUS, the titan who consumes life-giving energies of planets!

The watcher has been observing the Silver Surfer on his journey, and though he cannot act directly, using a Matter-Mobilizer, he attempts to misdirect the Surfer’s searching eyes by creating cover for the earth- first by fire, then with space-debris. But all is for naught, for the skilled Silver Surfer manouvers through the asteroids with ease, and upon landing, fires off a cosmic beacon into space- the signal that will bring the planet devourer to our home!

Ben attempts to stop the Surfer, but it is too late- minutes later, a giant spaceship arrives, and its inhabitant steps out- Galactus has arrived!
name: The Coming Of Galactus!

description:
The Brutal Betrayal of Ben Grimm!

A reprinted story from Fantastic Four #41. The Frightful Four have returned once again to do battle with the Fantastic Four, but this time they have an ace up their sleeve: The WIngless Wizard has devised a deadly new weapon- the ID MACHINE, a brainwashing device, that they have used on poor Ben, now a fighting mad member of the Frightful Four!

To Save You, Why Must I Kill You?

A reprinted story from Fantastic Four #42. The battle between the Fantastic Four and The Frightful Four-plus Ben- continue, with Human Torch pretending to be hypnotized, too, so he can infiltrate the Frightful Four camp and find out just what's going on!

The Terrible Trio!

A reprinted story from Strange Tales #129.
name: To Save You, Why Must I Kill You?

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #51

The Thing is wandering around in the rain feeling sorry for himself because he thinks he's been rejected by his love. He stumbles across a man that seems to be sympathetic to Ben Grimm's concerns and problems and seems to give him a sympathetic shoulder. After a drugged cup of coffee, this scientist uses his "Duplication Apparatus" and makes himself the Thing while returning Ben Grimm to his human form. This Scientist plans to take revenge on Reed Richards, who he believes to be a glory hound. After convincing the Fantastic Four that he's the real thing and the person claiming to be Ben Grimm is in fact a fake, he plots his revenge on Reed Richards.

Note: This issue reprints one of the most popular Fantastic Four issues, if not the most popular of all! When one looks at top 10 lists for Fantastic Four issues, #51 appears quite often.
name: This Man- This Monster!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #54
name: Whosoever Finds The Evil Eye--!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #56
name: Klaw, The Murderous Master of Sound!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #61
name: Where Stalks the Sandman

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #62
name: And One Shall Save Him!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #65
name: I Accuse!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #66
name: What Lurks Behind The Beehive?

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #68
name: His Mission: DESTROY the Fantastic Four!

description: The two greatest armies of the ancient world—Greek and Trojan—meet on the plains of Troy…with the achingly beautiful Helen as the prize! And as this battle-to-the-end-them-all rages, the gods themselves enter the fray!
name: Part Two

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #69
name: By Ben Betrayed!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #70
name: When Fall The Mighty

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #71
name: And So It Ends!

description:
An ancient evil spirit named Animus is awakened by its followers and travels to Jerusalem where it steals "The End of Days", one of the Dead Sea Scrolls.

April and Oyuki arrive in Israel with two large trunks in tow. The women take a taxi to a local hotel and we discover that the TMNT, Ninjara and Master Splinter were hiding in the large luggage. Shortly thereafter, a young military Private named Ariella Yahuda arrives and tells April that she'll be their tour guide for the Old City the following morning. Once Ariella departs, the TMNT have a big pillow fight while Master Splinter turns on the news. The broadcast shows a huge fight taking place on the streets of Old City, where tourists and citizens are fighting a pitched battle with one another. Also in the melee are Al'Falqa and Katmandu. Our heroes hurry out to investigate the violence, but April and Oyuki are met by Ariella, who tells them that they must stay at the hotel until the fighting has stopped. The TMNT have other plans and escape through a window.

The Turtles make it to the heart of the battle and discover that everyone involved is possessed - all of their eyes are blank white. Mike spots someone throwing a molotov cocktail into a car. The Turtle tries to retrieve it before it explodes, but he's too late and is caught in the blast.

Meanwhile, back at the hotel, Ariella spots the smoke from the car fire and transforms into a super-powered being named Golani before setting off in the direction of the explosion.
name: The Animus War part 1 of 2

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #77
name: Shall Earth Endure?

description:
1. Cover by Werner Roth, Vince Colletta and Murphy Anderson.
  2. "S.O.S. -- from Tomorrow!" written by Robert Kanigher, penciled by Werner Roth and inked by Vince Colletta. (Lois Lane, Superman, Morgan Edge Clone) Can Lois and Superman save some people from drug-dealers in the future?
  3. "The Needle in the Haystack!" Reprinted from Sensation Comics #87.
  4. "The Ghost with Two Faces!" written by Robert Kanigher, penciled by Rich Buckler and inked by Dick Giordano. (Rose and the Thorn)
name: S.O.S. -- from Tomorrow!  / The Needle in the Haystack! / The Ghost with Two Faces!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #81
name: Enter: The Exquisite Elemental!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #82

Maximus the Mad has enslaved the Inhumans, and has sent out his minions to bring back the remaining member of the royal family, Johnny's love Crystal, who has been residing with the FF for some time. Unfortunately for his plans, although the Alpha Primitives capture Crystal, they also bring back the Fantastic Four with them! The group battles against Maximus the Mad's robot soldier Zorr before the self appointed ruler unveils his greatest weapon- a long range Hypno-Gun, which will emit its rays over the entire world!
name: The Menace Of Maximus The Mad

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #83

Synopsis:

Amidst the Self-appointed coronation of Maximus the Mad, the Inhumans and the Fantastic Four break free of their prisons when Black Bolt reluctantly uses his voice to shatter the cages.

Once out, the Fantastic Four once again battle the robot Zorr while the Royal family make their way to the main chambers where Maximus is about to make good his threat of firing the Hypno-ray upon mankind!
name: Shall Man Survive?

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #84

On the way home from helping the Inhumans against the deadly Maximus the Mad, The Fantastic Four are intercepted by Nick Fury and Dum Dum Dugan.

It seems that one of S.H.I.E.L.D.'s agents has disappeared while investigating rumors of a secret army somewhere in Europe, The only thing he managed to send back was a fragmented arm of some powerful robot. While examining the arm, it comes back to life, and after a brief battle, the FF destroy it.

Nick Fury asks the team if they would investigate the area for them, which they reluctantly do. Making their way incognito into Latveria, they are accosted by a squad of robot soldiers who make quick work of the group.

When the Fantastic Four wake up, they find themselves in a fairy-tale village where everything is love and friendship-unless they try to leave-for the village is none other than Doctor Doom's prison for them!
name: The Name Is..DOOM!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #85
name: Within This Tortured Land!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #88
name: Victims

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #87
name: The Power and the Pride!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #88
name: A House There Was!

description: Vampirella tries to stop Pantha from killing scientists from her past.
name: Faster Pussycat! Kill! Kill!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #89
name: Madness of the Mole Man

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #90
name: The Skrull Takes A Slave!

description: A new Marvel Illustrated epic begins here! Painter Basil Hallward has done a portrait of a strange subject-youthful Dorian Gray, a man with a mysterious and tangled history. The young man broods on how unfair it is that he will age and his portrait will remain ever young. He wishes with all his might that it were otherwise-and in some bizarre, magical way-it is! This is a novel of dark wonders brilliantly brought to life in the heralded Marvel Illustrated style.
name: Part One

volume.name: Marvel Illustrated: The Picture Of Dorian Gray

description:
1. Safety First: All Year (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)
  2. Batman and Robin, Medieval Bandits (Superman and Batman / written by Bill Finger) The trio go back into medieval times.
  3. The Fish In The Iron Mask (Aquaman and Aqualad, Topo / written by Dave Wood) An ancient wizard tries to possess Topo's Brain
  4. Mystery of the Lost Cities (full text story)
  5. The Green Arrow Dummy (Green Arrow, Speedy / written by Ed Herron : reprinted in : Showcase Presents Green Arrow #1) Why is Speedy driving around with a Green Arrow dummy?
name: Batman and Robin, Medieval Bandits

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #92
name: Ben Grimm, Killer!

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #96
name: The Mad Thinker and his Androids of Death!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #99

Johnny has left the group to bring back Crystal, whom he believes has been taken back against her will back to the Inhumans Himalayan stronghold.
name: The Torch Goes Wild!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #100

Synopsis:

The FF are deluged with attacks by their various enemies all at once...it is only after battle that they discover that the villains are no more than androids, sent by The Mad Thinker and the Puppet Master to vanquish their foes!
name: The Long Journey Home

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #107

Synopsis:

The experiment on The Thing seems to be a success- Not only can Ben appear Human, when he wishes to, he can turn right back into the Ever Lovin' Blue-Eyed Thing! But there are hints that all is not well with Ben after the test...the transformation has also seemingly changed his attitude!

Meanwhile, Janus, an old colleague of Reed's, has arrived with the sole intention of getting into the Negative Zone!
name: And Now...The Thing!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #109

Reed, Ben and Johnny go into the Negative Zone to prevent Janus from bringing Annihilus out with him!
name: To DIE in the Negative Zone!

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Stan Kaye.
  2. "The Boy of Steel versus the Thing of Steel" written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by George Papp.
  3. Chapter 1: "The Amazing Bizarro" (Superboy, Bizarro, Martha Kent, Melissa, Kryptonite. Reprinted in: Superman Annual #2, DC Special Blue Ribbon Digest #15 & The Greatest Superman Stories Ever Told (1987)) This is the first appearance of Bizarro, who, in this story was made from a duplicator ray which made imperfect copies of the original, in this case Superboy (later Bizarros would have a different origin). Can Superboy defeat someone that has the same powers he does?
  4. Lost -- A Free Education! (public service message by Binky / written by Jack Schiff)
  5. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  6. Chapter 2: "The Runaway Super-Creature"
  7. Shorty (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  8. Casey the Cop (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  9. Smallville Mailsack (first Superboy letters page)
  10. Chapter 3: "The Battle with Bizarro"
  11. Razor Blade Radio (Superboy's Workshop)
name: The Boy of Steel versus the Thing of Steel

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #110

Reed has lost the device to bring him back from the Negative Zone, and it is up to the remaining three to get it to him so he can escape Annihilus! With the help of some magical diversion, Reed is able to slip past the Lord of the Negative Zone.

The Change in attitude that had begun showing signs earlier in Ben are now coming to the forefront; he has changed into a belligerent, arrogant person, and the group soon finds Ben has left the team to strike out on his own!
name: One From Four Leaves Three!

description:
Reprinting Fantastic Four #112

The Thing and The Hulk duke it out in the city, oblivious to their surroundings and causing danger to everyone around.

Despite the fact that Johnny had just been fighting with Ben himself, he knows that The Thing is no match for the Hulk, and is desperate for Reed to come down and help Ben out. Reed, however, knows that this isn't just about the Thing fighting the Hulk- it's about Ben's changed personality, and he knows he must create an antidote for Ben or they would be back at square one even if they were to stop the Hulk.

Meanwhile, Alicia has heard the commotion, and, worried for Ben, has come to the scene of the fight. The Thing and the Hulk have squared off and things seem pretty evenly matched, but when Ben hears Alicia cry out, he turns his head at the wrong moment, and the Hulk delivers a fatal blow.
name: Battle Of The Behemoths!

description:
1. The Invisible Life of Jimmy Olsen! (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lois Lane, Perry White, Lucy Lane, Daily Planet / written by Otto Binder) Reprinted in 80 Page Giant #13.

A space jewel makes Jimmy and the things he touches (like criminal evidence) invisible.

  1. "Jimmy Olsen, Supergirl's Pal!" (Jimmy Olsen, Supergirl, Superman, Zor-El (flashback), Allura / written by Otto Binder)

Is Supergirl real? Jimmy doesn't believe so.

  1. Shorty (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. "Jimmy Olsen, Juvenile Delinquent!" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Perry White / written by Robert Bernstein) Jimmy goes undercover to expose a criminal gang, but find out Perry's son is in it! Will Jimmy report this scoop? Reprinted in Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen #113.

Is Perry White's son part of a gang?
name: The Invisible Life of Jimmy Olsen!

description: Dorian has fallen madly in love with an actress because of her passion for her job, along with her looks. She quickly loses that passion and can only think of Dorian which greatly affects her acting. This pushes Dorian away and he breaks off the engagement...feeling the remorse in the morning he plans to apologize but it is too late for his fiancé is dead. As he passes his painting that evening he realizes that his wish has come true, but at a price. He stays young but is slowly turning sadistic and his painting is showing every bit of his cruelty.
name: Part Two

volume.name: Marvel Illustrated: The Picture Of Dorian Gray

description: Pursued by both the Mafia and covert ops assassins, Cheryl Montessori desires redemption, but must depend on the power of the demon within to survive, freeing Lady Demon in the process. Armed to the teeth, Lady Demon then proceeds to counter attack against Cheryl's enemies... hard!
name: Mission Diabolical

description:
1. The Menace of Muscles McGinnis

  2. Einstein--Master of Space and Time

  3. Sivana's Paralyzing Gas

  4. Return of the Mogul Diamond (full text story by Carl Formes)

  5. The Terror of the Goptas

  6. Strange But True (facts)

  7. The Beast Ruler

Animus arrives on the scene and declares that it has begun the Armageddon with the help of the End of Days scroll. Golani atacks the behemoth, who orders the possessed Al'Falqa and Katmandu to protect him. The TMNT and Ninjara have their hands full fending off human attackers. April and Oyuki arrive and try to get some footage of the battle. April shines a bright light on Animus, which cause the creature to recoil. Golani realizes that the monster fears the light, and so she blasts him with hers. Animus fades away, but vows that he will return that night.
Master Splinter reaches Michaelangelo's side, and discovers that his son has been blinded from the explosion that he was caught in.
Our heroes go back to their hotel to plan and recuperate. The group decides to take the fight to Animus and head off to find his hideout inside the Fortress of Nimrod. Oyuki stays behind with Mike, who can't leave due to his blindness.
Later that evening, the TMNT, Splinter, Ninjara, Al'Falqa and Katmandu find the Fortress entrance and go inside to investigate. They're immediately attacked by the men who freed Animus, but our heroes make short work of their foes. The Turtles find what they think is a giant statue of Animus, with the End of Days scroll at its base. Golani picks up the parchment and flies off with it - which causes the statue's eyes to glow. It wasn't a statue afterall, but Animus himself! Without the power of the scroll or its followers, the monster begins to shrink down in size, until its merely a few inches tall. Ninjara borrows a snow globe that Oyuki had bought as a souvenir and traps the miniature Animus inside. 
 
Back up story featuring the shocking death of the Mighty Mutanimals at the hands of the Gang of Four.
name: The Animus War part 2 of 2

description: It's a sizzling all out showdown between the hell bent covert operations group known as E.T.C., the Mob, and the notorious Lady Demon! To complicate matters, a supernatural psychological battle rages between Lady Demon and her human host, Cheryl Montessori for possession of the soul they share! Only one will emerge triumphant! That is, if any of them survive the showdown. The sense shattering conclusion!
name: El Diablo

description: The high-speed action and suspense explodes, with supernatural intrigue getting even hotter! Jade, the 4000-year-old vampire crime-lord continues with her plans to unify all the Triads of China beneath her rule... but something is horribly amiss! Why has Jade been suddenly plagued by strange dreams of a lover from her troubled past, and of a powerful, inhuman enemy believed long vanquished? This startling second issue has it all as the mysterious Mr. Ko and the forces of Kuei put plans in motion that will lead to the utter destruction of the vampire Jade and bring about the rebirth of the fearsome White Dragon, Pai Lung.

The insane martial arts action ignites even further from Chaos! After 4,000 years of emotional isolation has Jade again found love? Who is the mysterious figure that has somehow stolen her heart and why does he bear such a striking resemblance to the vampire sorceress' first love killed long ago? and what is his connection to the Chinese anti-crime organization called Kuei who will stop at nothing to destroy her? This powerful third issue delivers mind-numbing thrills as Pai Lung, the White Dragon again stalks the earth, hungering for revenge against the woman who originally destroyed him... Jade!

This is it, the pulse-pounding final chapter of the "Turn Loose the Dragon" saga! Suddenly in touch with her humanity again after 400 years, how will the vampire sorceress, Jade, cope with the burgeoning threats posed against her criminal empire by the resurrected White Dragon and the anti-crime organization, Kuei? This issue has it all as a trusted subject, within Jade's ranks, is revealed as a traitor! Mr. Ko hatches a mad scheme to take the White Dragon's power as his own, and Jade is forced to embrace the one thing in all the world that she despises most if she is going to be victorious against those that threaten her plans for China, she must embrace technology! Catch this nail- biting conclusion to the high-octane, martial arts epic!

Jade is back! In the second anime installment of Redemption, the sequel to the first smash-hit Jade mini-series, Jade is trapped between her ambitions and her attempts to make up for past sins. With her companion, Silence, she has traveled to the United States to destroy the American Triad families who stand against her, only to find herself under attack by a mysterious group, the Progeny. The Progeny have sent an assassin after her, a warrior locked within The Iron Racer, a suit of armor combining science and magic to create the ultimate vampire-hunting weapon. The Iron Racer would be a difficult enough force to combat, but the situation becomes even more dire when Jade discovers that inside The Iron Racer is Kayleigh Foster, an innocent but misguided teenager who is trapped in the armor and is determined to destroy Jade!

In the third anime (on paper) installment of Redemption, at last, Jade goes toe-to-toe against the deadly Iron Racer, the ultimate vampire fighting machine . . . and trust us when we say this battle isn't going to end the way you think it will! With the Iron Racer missing, the Triads force the mysterious Progeny to take terrible steps to stop Jade once and for all . . . by merging their operatives with the various earlier incarnations of the Iron Racer armor, all of which were deemed too psychotic or uncontrollable to ever use. But now they have no choice! Betrayal, deception, twisted science and magic, and the super-hot mute assassin Silence on a rampage! This one has it all! Recommended for fans of The Matrix, Crouching Tiger/Hidden Dragon, and anime!

At last, in this final anime installment of Redemption, all the strings are brought together as Jade's Triad enemies in China and America and the vampire hunting Progeny violently combine forces to hunt down the vampire sorceress whose struggle for redemption and righteousness has plagued them all! But this time, it's not only Jade and Silence whose lives are in the balance, but Kayleigh Foster (the Iron Racer) and her father Darius as well.
Reprinting Fantastic Four #76
name: Stranded in Sub-Atomica

description: Reprinting Fantastic Four #74
name: When Calls Galactus!
